data.content:
verb
also Brit compartmentalise -izes; -ized; -izing
[+ obj] somewhat formal
to separate (something) into sections or categories
He compartmentalizes his life by keeping his job and his personal life separate.
to separate (two or more things) from each other
The company has compartmentalized its services.
to put (something) in a place that is separate from other things
A soldier must be able to compartmentalize [=isolate] his emotions to focus on the mission.
